fields.description:
Good morning!

I've got this message: “You have hereby been granted read access to %RepositoryName%”. It does not ends with period as expected.

Best regards,

Victor
fields.summary: Punctuation inaccuracy in notification message (BB-1058)

fields.description: I tried to use '' in a semiverbatim environment, but it ended up as a " (closing double quote) instead.
fields.summary: semiverbatim turns two single quotes into a double quote ligature

fields.description:
I'm currently the owner of the Sage Rental repository. I'd like to pass off ownership to loric.\\
Is there any way that this can be accomplished?

Thanks,\\
Evan
fields.summary: I would like to pass a repo over to another user (BB-759)

fields.description: In the page available at https://bitbucket.org/account/welcome/ , in the right panel of "Helpful Resources", in section "Follow us" the URL of the link "Bitbucket blog" ( http://blog.bitucket.org/ ) is wrong - it's missing a "b".
fields.summary: Broken link to Bitbucket's blog on the Welcome page. (BB-958)

fields.description: I find hgweb's graph view (and its command-line counterpart, hg glog) extremely useful for viewing the repository's history. Please bring this to Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Graph view doesn't show when browser window isn't wider than page

fields.description: I have a patch that deletes a file in my [[https://bitbucket.org/khooyp/stp-khooyp|patch queue]], but trying to [[https://bitbucket.org/khooyp/stp-khooyp/qseries?apply=t&qs_apply=fix-aig-vecAtt-warning|view it]] or [[https://bitbucket.org/khooyp/stp-khooyp/qseries?apply=t&qs_apply=reveal-multiple-vc-double-free|any subsequent patches]] via the "Apply" button leads to a "Oops! An error occurred" message.
fields.summary: Can't apply patch that deletes a file (BB-1108)

fields.description:
Repository -> Admin -> User access\\
It stuck at "Loading ..."\\
I try refresh, change browser, reset router, etc ... but this stuck at Loading...\\
Can you fix it?

Thank you very much.\\
Long.
fields.summary: User access function still not work ...

fields.description:
I was looking at two issues and proceeded to mark one as duplicate of the other; I had confused the issue numbers and marked one of them as a duplicate of itself.

I'd like to rather get a message in that case saying "not much point".
fields.summary: Don't allow setting issue as duplicate of itself (BB-1107)

fields.description:
I have the Issues service set up on my repository (mchaput/whoosh) and it used to work (pre-acquisition, at least) but now doesn't anymore.

For an example where I had to manually close the bug after pushing a changeset with the "fixes" pattern in the message, see:

* https://bitbucket.org/mchaput/whoosh/changeset/c6716e31fe97

and

*https://bitbucket.org/mchaput/whoosh/issue/91/inversematcher_find_next#comment-331365
fields.summary: Issues service not working for me

fields.description:
Hello there,

When you are adding a new user to a private repository, the screen goes auto-completing the username and shows usernames that appear to be system-wide and not only users for that "account". At least for my case, my repos doesn't have users yet, so the field shouldn't have any users to select. Ain't this right?

My point is, for me, this is a security breach.
fields.summary: Add new user to repository shows (?) all bitbucket users

fields.description:
It would be damn cool if you guys would implement an option to deploy maven build artifacts as downloads in a repository.

I'm hosting one of my Atlassian plugins here at bitbucket and it would be great to just call maven's deploy mechanism to add a download.

Even if it is not possible, it would be cool to upload a download via the api (so I could write a maven plugin to handle that ;) )

What do you think?

Regards,\\
Mario
fields.summary: Maven deploy compatible Downloads API (BB-1106)

fields.description:
I am constantly encountering download.gz file being downloaded whenever I click a link in bitbucket.org.

It seems random event, sometimes it just navigates to the page I clicked, sometimes it just downloads the download.gz file.

It must be something wrong with your server's gz-compression settings.

Please fix this problem.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Chrome download.gz problem

fields.description:
I am constantly encountering download.gz file being downloaded whenever I click a link in bitbucket.org.

It seems random event, sometimes it just navigates to the page I clicked, sometimes it just downloads the download.gz file.

It must be something wrong with your server's gz-compression settings.

Please fix this problem.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Chrome download.gz problem

fields.description:
Loading http://nonsensopedia.wikia.com/ results in wrong content loaded and displayed to the user.

As far as I can check: original page is loaded, but after that there's probably a redirection to a different page or something like that (page's source code doesn't contain the original page's code).
fields.summary: Corrupted page when loading http://nonsensopedia.wikia.com/

fields.description: For some reason, your website comes up dead in IE 8. However it comes up fine in Firefox. Considering most users on the internet use IE, you may want to fix that.
fields.summary: Bitbucket.org website doesn't display in IE8

fields.description:
http://code.doughellmann.com/virtualenvwrapper/issues?sort=-reported_by

there doesn't seem to be much of any sorting going on there based on that column.
fields.summary: issue sort on reporter is sorting by user id not username (BB-1105)

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to edit and delete issue comments. Just like the issue itself.
fields.summary: editing/deleting issue comments (BB-1104)

fields.description:
I tried to make changes to the wiki at my project "weConnect", but when trying to push the changes back to Bitbucket, I just got:

{{{\\
pushing to https://xeophin:***@bitbucket.org/xeophin/weconnect/wiki\\
searching for changes\\
remote: ssl required\\
}}}

and the pushing failed, obviously. Pulling worked fine – I don't exactly see where I went wrong here.
fields.summary: Pushing to Wiki results in "SSL required"

fields.description: Currently the embed code points to the latest revision of the file. However I think a better default is to "tip" so that when someone updates the file it's automagically reflected in the embedding side.
fields.summary: Embed should link to "tip" and not latest revision

fields.description:
It seems that the mirror https://bitbucket.org/mirror/django-trunk hasn't been updated in 3 months. Please reactivate it.

If you point me to some other mirror that I should be using: how can I migrate the existing changesets?
fields.summary: django-trunk not mirrored

fields.description: There is a "Log In" link on every page, but using it always takes one to the home page.
fields.summary: Login should return to original page (BB-1102)

fields.description: Just because I want users to be able to access these it doesn't mean I want the world seeing them.
fields.summary: Allow robots noindex to be set for public issue trackers and wikis

fields.description: I find this view so helpful for clients... http://trac.edgewall.org/roadmap
fields.summary: A a roadmap view like trac has (BB-1100)

fields.description:
i would find the public newsfeed that appears on my dashboard FAR more useful if there were a way to filter out certain events.

in particular, the vast majority of items in that feed are people beginning to follow and stopping the following of projects that i am watching. those events are meaningless to me (although people following and leaving my own projects are not meaningless to me).

those [meaningless to me] events so out-number other events in the feed that i can't use it at all. although if i could limit it to just seeing commits and other non-meaningless-to-me events, it would be very useful.
fields.summary: following in public newsfeed (BB-923)

fields.description:
Hi, I'd like to remotely create a new repository (by cloning another). Then I can spare bandwidth by pushing additional changes to it, for review by others. And after the review and merge into the main reository, I'd like to be able to remotely delete the repository again :).

So far I could not find how this is possible using the REST API.
fields.summary: Support for cloning a new repository? (Fork API endpoint) (BB-1098)

fields.description:
I noticed bitbucket start using cloudfront as a cdn solution. And I been having trouble since then.

Turn out couldfront been giving 48+% packet lost. So it is causing the web page can't fully loaded:

{{{\\
ping cdn.bitbucket.org -t\\
Pinging d2aq0a746ftmav.nrt4.cloudfront.net [216.137.53.244] with 32 bytes of data:\\
...\\
...\\
Ping statistics for 216.137.53.22:\\
Packets: Sent = 587, Received = 302, Lost = 285 (48% loss),\\
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:\\
Minimum = 124ms, Maximum = 287ms, Average = 160ms\\
}}}

I'm from Shanghai China
fields.summary: cloudfront cdn report 48+% packet lost

fields.description:
Diff button on file viewing page doesn't seem to work.\\
If I click "Source" tab in a project, then select a file, from a drop down menu choose some revision and click "diff" button nothing happens. Address changes (?diff2=<rev-hash>?diff1=<rev-hash> is added) but nothing changes on the page.
fields.summary: diff button of source viewing page doesn't work (BB-643)

fields.description: When I create an issue with no content and try to edit it the editor hangs on "Loading..."
fields.summary: Cannot edit content of issue with no content (BB-1097)

fields.description: The user module that enables you to add bitbucket users to a repo just shows "Loading...".  It doesn't show the users that currently have access.  When trying to add a legitimate bitbucket user, it gives an error indicating the user doesn't exist.
fields.summary: The User module doesn't work

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket team,

I just logged back into my account an noticed that my dashboard is suddenly totally empty. Yet when I hover over my "Repositories"-tab I notice I can go to all my repositories. Is this a known issue at the moment?

Kind regards,\\
Tim van der Linden
fields.summary: Dashboard empty

fields.description:
I have just setup CI Modular Extensions - HMVC.

it's great!!

But i saw a problem following:

I create two modules.

*contact_mod* to place at application/controllers/contact_mod.php

*product_mod* to place at application/modules/product/product_mod.php

when i test it:

Modules::run('contact_mod/data') => call data method => work great!

Modules::run('contact_mod') => call index method (default by CI) => work great!!

Modules::run('product/product_mod/data') => call data method => work great!

but i call:

Modules::run('product/product_mod') => call index method (default by CI) => Not working.

Please check it again and report for me:

sincos.com@gmail.com

Thank very much!
fields.summary: Can't load default index method

fields.description:
I have a wiki page for my project on bitbucket with pictures (https://bitbucket.org/zzsergant/hgsccpackage/wiki/ScreenShots).

Everything was fine until yesterday, when I found that pictures are broken on page.

Is it a known issue ?
fields.summary: Broken links to a pictures on wiki

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm unable to push into private repository https://aramzamzam@bitbucket.org/aramzamzam/ipapka

every I'm receiving empty error

http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: aramzamzam\\
password:\\
pushing to https://aramzamzam@bitbucket.org/aramzamzam/ipapka\\
searching for changes\\

fields.summary: bugged repository - unable to push

fields.description:
The listbox where the language of a repository can be set contains a whole bunch of languages, common ones as well as never heard of ones.

Alas, LaTeX as well as TeX are missing. Could at least TeX (or maybe even both) be added to the list?
fields.summary: Language setting: LATeX / TeX missing (BB-921)

fields.description:
Sometimes a user might commit under several user IDs - maybe "John Doe [jdoe%40company.example.com]" as well as "John Doe [me%40johndoe.example.com]" additionally or alternatively to the email address which he uses to login. In this case, he has to edit every single repo he owns in order to get this right.

But it might be useful to set these settings once for the complete user account. Might that feature be added?
fields.summary: Alias

fields.description:
Repo: redmine/redmine

Hello, I tried to strip some branches out of the repo, which resulted on a Error on last(!) strip I run. :-)

since then, I am not able to push anymore to the repo, I would like to keep the repo because it has forks based on it or followers.

Is it possible to fix this?

BTW:: the style of this form seems broken, I don't see what I type. (Firefox 3.6.12)

Greets\\
Ammler
fields.summary: remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!

fields.description:
I use this in my app, but I found a wrong size with switch or slide, is this a bug?

http://www.geocities.jp/mikezang/iPad/SnapShot2010-12-23-17-14-29.jpg
fields.summary: The size is not correct iPad

fields.description: Even as I write this bug, the pages is a little off. Most notably, the "Properties" pane extends past where it probably should, and covers the content pane. I'm running IE8, on Windows 7.
fields.summary: The create new issue page looks a little off on ie8

fields.description:
I can't seem to link to image files in the wiki.  The links cause the browser to throw security problems because they seem to resolve to bytebucket.org instead of bitbucket.org.

All files that are references as relative path links in a wiki page fail in this way.
fields.summary: Images links in wiki resolving to bytebucket.org instead of bitbucket.org

fields.description: When retrieving changesets, the REST api currently seems to support only changeset ids. If I don't know the hash for a repository with a longer history, I can't get the first commit.  My feature request is to keep the current scheme /repositories/USERNAME/REPO_SLUG/changesets/NODE/, but NODE could mean either a hash, or a revision number.
fields.summary: Use revision number to get changesets in REST API (BB-894)

fields.description: I tried the example query at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BBDEV/Repositories But running curl "https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/?name=django-", the resource_uri was missing, opposed to the documentation.  Having neither a username, nor a resource_uri, I can't really locate the repository.
fields.summary: Repository listing doesn't include "resource_uri" in REST API (BB-1096)

fields.description:
i have a wiki tutorial hosted on bitbucket and when i just looked at it, all the embedded images were not showing up for me (although they used to).

when i dug into the reason why, it turned out that the images were being served from 'bytebucket.org' instead of bitbucket.org AND, it looks like all requests to bitbucket.org are now being redirected to SSL, but the bitbucket.org SSL cert does not cover bytebucket.org and therefore, safari was refusing to accept the images until i manually stuck in a trust exception for bytebucket.org.

here is the wiki in question:\\
https://bitbucket.org/pjv/perftest/wiki/Home
fields.summary: images in wiki (ADM-11355)

fields.description: would be great to get hgbb independent of the descendants page markup
fields.summary: descendants in api (BB-50)

fields.description: After typping a comment to a issue and setting to leave the actual status, after the submitting the status changes back to "new"
fields.summary: Unable to clone a repository over ssh

fields.description:
Viewing an issue, I double-click its title to edit. It turns into a text field. I make my changes. Then, as soon as I leave the field, it reverts back to its pre-edited state.

Safari 5.0.2 OS X
fields.summary: Editing issue title doesn't work

fields.description:
Viewing an issue, I double-click its title to edit. It turns into a text field. I make my changes. Then, as soon as I leave the field, it reverts back to its pre-edited state.

Safari 5.0.2 OS X

fields.summary: Repository protostome/msock failed; admin page is inaccessible
List Style... Outside?? (BB-748)

fields.description:
I've tried multiple email addresses to different providers.  I don't believe the service has ever worked for my current active repository. 'Email' did work on an earlier repository, when 'email-diff' did not work with private repos.

(These are both private repos.)
fields.summary: No emails being received from services (either email-diff or email)

fields.description:
When I try to connect to the repository by SSH to hg@bitbucket.org, I get following error: "Permission denied (publickey)."

Please fix it as soon as possible

fields.description:
Hi, Do you guys think it will be possible for creating and extracting comments from an issue through the API. The API have a lot of functionality right now, but I really need this one.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: API Feature Request: Comment in issues (BB-865)

fields.description:
In "commented on" entries in my RSS feed, both the issue link and the project link contain an extra "/" character, which returns a 404 error when clicked.

Examples:\\
https://bitbucket.org//birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/515/keyerror-while-building#comment-316061

https://bitbucket.org//birkenfeld/sphinx

https://bitbucket.org/ubipurchase/ns-3-lena-trunk

Have tried creating/deleteing and recreating, now 16 hours later if I goto the admin page it shows it as a fault. Nothing seems to be happening.

When you press "send message" from user main page, receiver in form is empty:\\
Example url: https://bitbucket.org/account/notifications/send/?receiver=slav0nic

fields.description:
In this changeset:\\
https://bitbucket.org/vgrit/r2/changeset/3a36180ed5c0\\
in file R2System.cs, line 145, a blank line is shown as being added instead of the comment that was added. All looks well in hg, it is just the changeset viewer in bitbucket thats broken.

I realize that this is a private repo, but maybe staff at bitbucket can view the changeset anyway?
fields.summary: Changeset viewer skips a line in diff (BB-1090)

fields.description:
The time to change my user email <<user gerardorochin>>, about switching to registered on the system with the user <<user culiacan>>, let me put the same email being present in both accounts, then try to reset the password to the user so I <<user gerardorochin>> sent two separate email with a link to reset for each account.

I think the system deve not accept two accounts with the same email.
fields.summary: To reset the password I get two emails to two counts

fields.description: i just noticed it would be nice to have a list of alternatives in case of simple typos
fields.summary: conq should suggest closely named repos as alternative in case of missin

fields.description: Please add TeX/LaTeX to the langage drop-down box
fields.summary: Please add TeX/LaTeX to the langage drop-down box (BB-817)

fields.description:
Trying to commit 2011 files with a combined weigth of 110MBs, bitbucket returns:

HTTP Error 504: Gateway Time-out\\
[command interrupted]

Any ideas?
fields.summary: HTTP Error 504: Gateway Time-out

fields.description:
Here is an example -

h1. HG changeset patch -- Bitbucket.org
--- snip ---

h1. Date 1292330179 -3600
h1. Node ID 0ac44185b98e4f27f61c90276b52d416b64bf332
h1. Parent  5a6008fd07177e50ac5a68f1c280f222bed3f38a
added some text

--- /dev/null\\
+++ b/test\\
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@\\
+asdas\\
+\\
+\\
+\\
+asasdsad
fields.summary: Email diff contains UNIX timestamp date format (BB-819)

fields.description:
Please would it be possible to have the following features added to the API:

h1. The current status of an issue
h1. A list of comments made on an issue
h1. The raw changeset
If one and two aren't possible then can we at least have a last modified date pretty please
fields.summary: API feature request (BB-1066)

fields.description:
this is rather inconvient for projects that rely on named branches

(like pypy)
fields.summary: email diff doesn't contain branch (BB-816)

fields.description:
Close BCLOUD-2 standalone client

Close/Closes does not work, at this point.
fields.summary: Commit message hooks

fields.description:
My repository had the source code page configured to be the default/start page and I deleted this repository adding a redirection link...

So now, when I access its page (http://bitbucket.org/semente/libcss-taurinus) I'm redirected to {{{libcss-taurinus/src}}} that doesn't show me the redirection link as in {{{libcss-taurinus/overview}}}.
fields.summary: Incorrect redirection page after repository removal (BB-790)

fields.description:
On bitbucket.org/username/repository/overview clicking on the username in the repo-menu section (where it appears as username/repository) links to the user page (bitbucket.org/username).

On code.example.com/repository/overview clicking on the username in the same area in the repo-menu section links to the current page.

This seems to be the same for every page, the personal domain link always links to the current page, whether it's overview, downloads, source, etc
fields.summary: Inconsistent Linking (BB-685)

fields.description:
==== Steps to reproduce: ====

h1. Log out of Bitbucket
h1. Attempt to Follow a repository.
==== Expected Result ====

"Do you feel authenticated, punk?"

==== Observed result: ====

An AJAX spinner replaces the Heart icon, and never ends.  It's easy not to notice my session has expired.
fields.summary: Attempting to Follow a repo should prompt for login when not logged in (BB-1089)

fields.description: "you have no private repositores"
fields.summary: typo on Account page

fields.description:
The upgrade notes in the blog talk about better scaling after a recent upgrade:

"An unexpected side benefit to the new deployment is that we’re seeing upwards of a 10% performance increase for push and pull operations"

I didn't use bitbucket yesterday after the upgrade, but today I noticed that the hg clone operation is very significantly slower than before - so much slower that some automated build processes on my side actually time out on it. These are hg clones over ssh.
fields.summary: bitbucket hg clone over ssh significantly slower

fields.description:
I've used UTF-8 characters (Russian) when committing wiki pages. Wiki pages itself displays correctly, but when I look through wiki history - they are displayed incorrectly:\\
Р”РѕР±Р°РІРёР» РѕРїРёСЃР°РЅРёРµ РїСЂРѕРµРєС‚Р°.
fields.summary: UTF-8 symbols in wiki history (BB-1088)

fields.description:
http://hg.splayer.org/splayer/issue/8/updatecontroller#comment-312752

link to changeset r1670:82ee6435ae74 become http://hg.splayer.org/Tomasen/splayer/changeset/82ee6435ae74 , which returns error

in fact it should be\\
http://hg.splayer.org/splayer/changeset/82ee6435ae74
fields.summary: error link to changeset in custom domain (BB-685)

fields.description:
hi, i didn't see my bug in my tracking list, so i'm reopening it here. we're paying customers, have been for years, and just re-upped post-buyout.

the problem: one of our repositories _never_ emails notifications on repo sync. the repo is set up to do so, and it's not getting filtered on my side - the emails never arrive. the repository:

https://bitbucket.org/bobkuehne/bluenewtdev

this has been broken for several months, and we kept hoping that it was just not addressed due to churn over the buyout. but this is a critical bug for us. please let us know your plans.

thank you, bob
fields.summary: no notifications on my repository

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

h1. create <account>.bitbucket.org repo
h1. add a subrepo to it
h1. try to browse the contents of the subrepo on http://<account>.bitbucket.org
Expected, files are browsable. Actual: they aren't.
fields.summary: User site repos don't resolve contents of subrepos

fields.description:
Doing "hg out" consistently takes between 33 and 34 seconds, regardless of repo. Has been doing this for a couple of days. Tested with tree different user/repos[1] . Tested from two different networks as well. Only tested using SSH.

Something takes 30 seconds to time out perhaps?

[1]: http://bitbucket.org/hzr_opera/dragonfly-redesign, http://bitbucket.org/scope/dragonfly-stp-1, http://bitbucket.org/runeh/opera-unshorten
fields.summary: Push  / outgoing is slow

fields.description:
Currently, for URLs in a ticket text the text parser will include brackets in the URL which shouldn't be as brackets can be escaped. Examples:

* Test (http://tortoisesvn.net) text
* Test [http://tortoisesvn.net] text
fields.summary: Wiki is dropping closing parens in URLs (BB-1087)

fields.description:
I utilize the site in Firefox; I've noticed instances where the content box on the 'Create new issue' page doesn't properly expand. What end up happening is I can't see what I'm typing. If I try to expand it manually, it snaps back when I start typing covering everything.

Additionally, the Properties (on the right) end up overlapping the content box. The content box itself is off set to the right and doesn't line up with things.
fields.summary: Issue Editor Content Box (BB-993)

fields.description:
After last upgrade (Wendsday 8th December) my site http://ur6lad.bitbucket.org/ return "404 not found".

Yesterday it works.
fields.summary: The published website not shown

fields.description:
Internal error

Uncaught exception: NSRangeException\\
Cannot remove an observer <RepoController 0x12c7600> for the key path "isRunning" from <HgOperation 0x12719a0> because it is not registered as an observer.

{code}
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueObserverRegistration) _removeObserver:forProperty:] (in Foundation)
-[NSObject(NSKeyValueObserverRegistration) removeObserver:forKeyPath:] (in Foundation)
-[RepoController(Actions) _closeProgressSheet] (in Murky)
-[RepoController(Actions) _cloneDidEnd:result:url:] (in Murky)
-[RepoController(Actions) _pushSheetDidEnd:returnCode:context:] (in Murky)
-[NSApplication endSheet:returnCode:] (in AppKit)
-[RepoController(Actions) endCommitSheet:] (in Murky)
-[NSApplication sendAction:to:from:] (in AppKit)
-[NSControl sendAction:to:] (in AppKit)
-[NSCell _sendActionFrom:] (in AppKit)
-[NSCell trackMouse:inRect:ofView:untilMouseUp:] (in AppKit)
-[NSButtonCell trackMouse:inRect:ofView:untilMouseUp:] (in AppKit)
	
{code}

Please report this bug (you can copy & paste the text).
fields.summary: I try to clone repository

fields.description:
In the repo https://bitbucket.org/jglick/ml-hgext, there are some changesets made by the original author: user: Marcus Lindblom [macke%40yar.nu] and some by me in a fork: user: Jesse Glick [jglick%40bitbucket.org] In the HTML version of this page, my changes are listed as Jesse Glickwhereas Marcus's are listed as Marcus LindblomWhen I am logged in to the site, my name is given as plain text, whereas Marcus's is hyperlinked: marcusl In https://bitbucket.org/jglick/ml-hgext/changesets also Marcus is hyperlinked while I am not (whether or not I am logged in):
Jesse Glick
Marcus Lindblom / marcusl
Why the inconsistency?
fields.summary: Inconsistent hyperlinking of author

fields.description:
I've a lot of repositories and would be great if there was some way to organize them.  Something like folders or [labels|BCLOUD-11800].

*2015-09-06 Dan Bennett:*\\
_Added link to an issue requesting support for labels (issue BCLOUD-11800). We will finish "projects" under this issue but labels and projects are not mutually exclusive therefore labels should continue to be tracked._

** Update 2015-12-17: **\\
This feature is currently available as an opt-in beta. Go to your account settings and you should see a new "[Manage features|https://bitbucket.org/account/admin/features/]" option. Enabling Projects on _your account_ will allow you to create and manage projects on any team for which you are an admin, and see projects on other teams as well. If you'd like collaborators to see your projects as well ask them to turn on the feature on their own account.
fields.summary: Create a way to group repositories/projects or folders (BB-1086)

fields.description:
This is what I get when taking a stab at the correct url for an issues comments (as I couldn't find it documented anywhere):

curl https://<username>:<password>@api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/which_linden/eventlet/issues/68/comments/

Piston/0.2.3rc1 (Django 1.2.3) crash report:

Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django_piston-0.2.3rc1-py2.7.egg/piston/handler.py", line 84, in read\\
pkfield = self.model._meta.pk.name

AttributeError: 'IssueCommentHandler' object has no attribute 'model'
fields.summary: Can't get comments for an issue via REST (BB-1008)

fields.description: It would be convenient if I can reply to the issue notification mail directly to add some comments instead of opening up a web browser.
fields.summary: reply to issue via email (BB-1452)

fields.description: Github & gitorious support this.  This is handy for code review.
fields.summary: add comment support for commits/changsets (BB-386)

fields.description:
I tried to change my username to 'mkontag' via my account settings page.  The change did not persist (my username is currently still 'kmontag'), but another member who has access to some of my private repositories seems to have had his username changed - he now shows up as 'mkontag' in feeds, and can only log in as 'mkontag'.

Additionally, I can no longer view any of my repositories (http://bitbucket.org/kmontag/[repo-name] gives a permanent "Creating your repository" message, and http://bitbucket.org/mkontag/[repo-name] gives a not-found page).  Direct links to e.g. issues in my repositories give an error page.

I'm not sure if it's related, but just before I changed my username, I tried to upgrade my account and kept getting an "invalid username and email address combination" message on the Atlassian shopping cart.
fields.summary: Tried to change own username, but someone else's ended up changed (BB-484)

fields.summary: Printing the report

fields.description:
Getting an Individual Issue is useless since it does not provide enough information about the issue.

{{{\\
#!bash

$ curl https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/jespern/bitbucket/issues/64/

{\\
"title": "easy_install functionality",\\
"comment_count": 1,\\
"content": "Or something like it..?",\\
"created_on": "2008-07-21 16:04:35",\\
"reported_by": {\\
"username:" "madssj",\\
"resource_uri": "/1.0/users/madssj/"\\
},\\
"local_id": 64,\\
"follower_count": 2,\\
"metadata": {\\
"kind": "bug"\\
},\\
"resource_uri": "/1.0/repositories/jespern/bitbucket/issues/64/",\\
"is_spam": false\\
}

}}}

It would be great to get issue's comments, to whom it is assigned, links to attached files etc..
fields.summary: Getting an Individual Issue via API (BB-1085)
User's repositories list getting via API (BB-797)

fields.description:
Sorry to spam you with visual bugs but these are kind of annoying and I figured you'd appreciate knowing about them.

This is fixed for me if the table has "table-layout: fixed" and td.issues-list-number is given a width like 40px. (Otherwise that column collapses.) I've attached a screenshot showing the issue.
fields.summary: Issues list table overflows the page layout (Safari 5 on OS X 10.6.5) (BB-1035)

fields.description: Maybe this is intentional, but it looks as if there should be a top border on this box. (See screenshot.)
fields.summary: Top border missing on issue tracker header

fields.description: I've attached a screenshot of what I'm seeing. Removing the left margin on the <textarea> should fix the problem.
fields.summary: New issue <textarea> is offset (Safari 5 on OS X 10.6.5)

fields.description:
Obviously the tokens '--' are not allowed WITHIN a comment in a Galaxy Tool XML File!\\
example:

<!-- [...] R --slave --vanilla [...] -->So it's an issue everytime you uncomment shell commands with options included.
fields.summary: XML-parsing of comments

fields.description:
A basic query looking at open issues:\\
http://bitbucket.org/isaiah/kiwi-public/issues?status=open

Now add the filter that it also must be a bug:\\
http://bitbucket.org/isaiah/kiwi-public/issues?status=open&kind=bug

This lists many more issues instead of fewer as expected.

It seems to me that query parameters are ORing instead of ANDing.
fields.summary: issue tracker queries do not work as expected

fields.description:
Starting with a few days ago I can no longer seem to edit the titles of issues. This is quite critical to me.

I have been editing the titles to get a priority and difficulty like so:

|=Priority         |=Difficulty         |\\
|P1 - Critical    |D1 - Extreme |\\
|P2 - High       |D2 - Hard  |\\
|P3 - Normal    |D3 - Normal  |\\
|P4 - Low        |D4 - Easy  |\\
|P5 - Minor      |D5 - Trivial  |

That is P3D4 is something that is not too bad and relatively easy to fix. A P4D1 issue is a minor bug which is extremely hard to fix, etc...

The system works ok, see eg: http://bitbucket.org/jfh/machg/issues?status=new&status=open

In any case its quite important for the repository managers to be able to edit the titles if the user reported something which is actually something else.

(BTW although I have said it before: thanks for bitbucket!)
fields.summary: Can't change the title of issues

fields.description:
When source code have many tabs or long lines, text overflows it's div container (check pic).

To fix this add css:\\
overflow-x: scroll;

to "bb-hl" class. Scroll bar in div will appear if we have long text then.
fields.summary: source embed long text overflow (BB-1084)

fields.description:
here's a good example\\
http://bitbucket.org/isaiah/kiwi-public/wiki/features

it just makes one query.  but generates a very obtuse error message.
fields.summary: wiki queries seem broken

fields.description:
Hi,

Maybe I am doing something wrong, but lets say the tip is on r99, and I browse through the repository on bitbucket, click on a file, then I see what appears to be my file showing the diff with the last change, say r54. Now I want to see what happened between this latest file r99 and a really old version r28. I click on drop down box and select r28, then click on diff. At this point, I see exactly the same page, i.e., the r99 diff with r54. I can do this r99 diff against r28 from command line, but it does not work on bitbucket.

Am I doing something wrong or is this a bug?

thanks
fields.summary: diff against other revisions does nothing

fields.description: Since Nov. 25th, my dashboard is not updated with new activity, even though I have been adding issues and committing code against them. When I go to the source tab, referenced issues are displayed as hyperlinks. I need to go to the change sets tab to see issue numbers hyperlinked.
fields.summary: My dashboard stopped getting recent activity six days ago.

fields.description: It seems that actions on private repositories appear nonetheless on public feeds (at least on the repository's owner's page), leading to private information leak (commit messages, activity, etc...)
fields.summary: No event for private repositories should appear in public feeds

fields.description:
If user request address to some directory without trailing slash, then it should be automatically redirected to the URL containing such slash.

Lack of trailing slash after path to particular directory makes relative links available at the page shown there unusable. Example:\\
http://libqxt.bitbucket.org/doc
fields.summary: Accessing directory without trailing slash in URL (BB-758)
